alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Mellette and Todd Counties; Southern Black Hills; Tripp County (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 21 at 6:49PM MDT until October 22 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Will Continue Through Saturday For Portions of Northeast Wyoming and Southern South Dakota... .Warm, dry, and breezy weather will continue on Saturday across portions of northeast Wyoming and southwest South Dakota. Combined with dry fuels, this will produce critical fire weather conditions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 320, 321, 324, 325, 332, 333, 334, AND 335... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 320 Central Black Hills, 321 Southern Black Hills, 324 Eastern Foot Hills, 325 Custer County Plains, 332 Badlands Area, 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County. * WINDS...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 11 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Central Black Hills; Custer County Plains; Eastern Foot Hills; Mellette and Todd Counties; Southern Black Hills; Tripp County
